channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Will Assad Survive in Syria? And Will the Conflict Widen Into a Regional War?
item.description:
Rebels in Syria are making rapid advances against the government forces of President Bashar al-Assad. Assad has managed to stay in power throughout the civil war that has engulfed his country for more than a decade. But he again finds himself in a precarious position. We weigh the chances of his political survival.

And in Lebanon, residents are watching as Syrian rebels get closer and closer to their border. There is concern that the fighting will spill over, threatening a fragile ceasefire between Israel and Hezbollah and perhaps becoming a regional war.
item.content:encoded:
Rebels in Syria are making rapid advances against the government forces of President Bashar al-Assad. Assad has managed to stay in power throughout the civil war that has engulfed his country for more than a decade. But he again finds himself in a precarious position. We weigh the chances of his political survival.

And in Lebanon, residents are watching as Syrian rebels get closer and closer to their border. There is concern that the fighting will spill over, threatening a fragile ceasefire between Israel and Hezbollah and perhaps becoming a regional war.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: USDA orders testing across nation's milk supply amid rising bird flu cases
item.description: The virus has spread to over 710 dairy herbs across 15 states, with California reporting the highest number of infections. At least 58 people have been infected with bird flu, including one child.
item.content:encoded:
The virus has spread to over 710 dairy herbs across 15 states, with California reporting the highest number of infections. At least 58 people have been infected with bird flu, including one child.

(Image credit: Patrick T. Fallon)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: The holidays are peak time for volunteers, but how about the rest of the year?
item.description: Thanksgiving Day kicks off a wave of volunteers stirred by the holiday spirit, but those in charge of local charities say they'd rather have that help at other times of the year.
item.content:encoded:
Thanksgiving Day kicks off a wave of volunteers stirred by the holiday spirit, but those in charge of local charities say they'd rather have that help at other times of the year.

(Image credit: Andrew Stelzer for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Andrew Stelzer

item.title: Election confidence among Republicans surges after Trump's win, a new poll finds
item.description: Almost 9 in 10 U.S. voters felt the November election was run well, according to new survey data. That's a jump compared with 2020 — an increase driven exclusively by Republican voters.
item.content:encoded:
Almost 9 in 10 U.S. voters felt the November election was run well, according to new survey data. That's a jump compared with 2020 — an increase driven exclusively by Republican voters.

(Image credit: Gregory Shamus)
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: A company that turned homeowners into renters abruptly shuts down
item.description: EasyKnock, which pioneered 'sale-leaseback' deals for struggling homeowners, abruptly closes its doors
item.content:encoded:
EasyKnock, which pioneered 'sale-leaseback' deals for struggling homeowners, abruptly closes its doors

(Image credit: Sylvia Jarrus for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Caitlin Thompson

item.title: Young people are dying of heat and their risks could grow, study finds
item.description: Scientists have pointed out that extreme heat is particularly dangerous for older people. A new study shows that young, healthy people are also dying too often in extreme weather.
item.content:encoded:
Scientists have pointed out that extreme heat is particularly dangerous for older people. A new study shows that young, healthy people are also dying too often in extreme weather.

(Image credit: Ulises Ruiz)
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Borunda

item.title: Coronavirus FAQ: I didn't get the latest COVID vaccine. Should I? And if so ... when?
item.description: If you haven't rolled up your sleeve for the jab, you're not alone. In fact, you're in the majority. Here's why doctors think the shot is important.
item.content:encoded:
If you haven't rolled up your sleeve for the jab, you're not alone. In fact, you're in the majority. Here's why doctors think the shot is important.

(Image credit: Deb Cohn-Orbach/UCG/)
item.dc:creator: Fran Kritz

item.title: The body of a woman missing near a Pennsylvania sinkhole has been found
item.description: The remains 64-year-old Elizabeth Pollard, who fell into a sinkhole, were recovered Friday, four days after she went missing while searching for her cat, a state police spokesperson said.
item.content:encoded:
The remains 64-year-old Elizabeth Pollard, who fell into a sinkhole, were recovered Friday, four days after she went missing while searching for her cat, a state police spokesperson said.

(Image credit: Matt Freed)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: She's 74 — and expecting: Wisdom the albatross astounds once again
item.description: It started in the Eisenhower era: Every year, Wisdom, a Layan albatross, has returned to her nesting grounds on the Midway Atoll in the Pacific Ocean.
item.content:encoded:
It started in the Eisenhower era: Every year, Wisdom, a Layan albatross, has returned to her nesting grounds on the Midway Atoll in the Pacific Ocean.

(Image credit: Dan Rapp)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: This little electric car made history. 25 years ago, GM stopped making it
item.description: The EV1 was the first modern, mass-produced electric vehicle from a major automaker — pioneering some technologies you can still find in today's EVs. But the model was controversial, and short-lived.
item.content:encoded:
The EV1 was the first modern, mass-produced electric vehicle from a major automaker — pioneering some technologies you can still find in today's EVs. But the model was controversial, and short-lived.

(Image credit: General Motors Co.)
item.dc:creator: Jack Mitchell
